text: Fenbeasts are magical constructs, made of the foul mud and rotting wood of Albion. They are powered by the shard of an Ogham Stone within their body and said to be animated by the souls of those who died in the swamps.
Fimm Warriors riding to war on the back of Bog Beasts, daemonic servant creatures from the dark depths of the swamps.
Despite having no depth perception, the Fimir are pretty good at throwing javelins at enemies.
Every Fimir clan has a small cabal of apprentice Balefiends that serves directly under the tutelage of the Meargh.
Dirachs are known as 'Daemon-Friends'. Their spellcasting second only to the Meargh's among Fimir they shape the very weather of the marshes to aid their foul cause.
Finmor are lesser Fimir lords who aspire to be given the honour of leading their own raiding parties or units of Fimm Warriors.
The Fianna are the elite of the Fimm Warriors, hand-picked, sometimes at birth, sometimes as a result of some great deed.
The highest ranking member of the Noble caste usually leads the Fimir army in the field - and that's always the strongest of them.
Skattach is one of the most powerful living Mearghs - the witch-queens of the Fimir - which has led to her claiming the mantle of Hellmother, ruler of all Fimir Clans.

These horrifying, fleshless amalgams of man and horse are among the cruellest and most monstrous of the daemons summoned by the Fimir. Once they emerge from their refuges beneath the waters, only destruction satifies their merciless crusade.

The product of a powerful daemon being successfully bound within the body of a Fimir of the warrior caste. The possessed Fimir grows to an enormous size and may mutate to have one or both of its hands end in a long blade.
Longtime servants and allies of the Fimir, Swamp Daemons stalk through the waters, barely seen until they strike.

A massive, mobile altar made from rotting wood, pulled forth by a Fenbeast. Atop the diamond-chamber floats a mighty Oculus, a daemonic servant of Balor, to oversee the Fimir and destroy their foes with its gaze.
These veteran riders of the Fimir inflict a painful sting on the enemy's flanks.
The name of the Fimir warrior who provided the host body of the Daemonomaniac is long forgotten, but he became the most successful and powerful creation of the Dirach.
These nightmarish creatures have haunted and terrorized the moors of Basker for centuries.
Boglars made a pact with the cyclopean creatures and now they fight side by side, why the Fimir would make deals with such puny creatures is a mystery.
Devoted to the Daemonprince Balor, these fanatics worship their god blindly.
Fanatic unto death. Their clans destroyed, they raid and pillage with the sole purpose of killing in cruel ways.
Rumors tell of creatures living near a haunted, icy lake in the northern part of Albion. The native folks call them Gharnu's Daemon-Friends.
Tall as a troll and easily as strong, Mistmor are prized as defenders of Fimir settlements.
The Fianna are the elite of the Fimm Warriors, hand-picked, sometimes at birth, sometimes as a result of some great deed.
The Guards are sometimes found leading bands of Orcs and Goblins, but are dangerous enough even when encountered singly.
The slave caste of the Fimir. While lower in ranks, Shearls are still a fearsome foe.
They terrorize the swamps, stalking livestock and lonely travelers until the daemonic hounds are summoned by the Fimir, where they know they will dine well on battlefield carcasses.
When Killing Eye clan was left without a leader, the retinues of Fimm warriors set out to seek a new Meargh or their ultimate annihilation.
Some Boglars have a innate talent for magic. They often rise to positions of leadership within their tribe.
Once caught by a Bog Octopus's tentacle, it is very hard for all but the strongest creatures to escape!
Mighty Daemon Prince and Mother of the Bog Octopuses, worshipped by all Fimir.
